messages.message:
Here's the Python module proposal for review. Any comments welcome! In particular, I propose we move to this system in 2 steps:
• update all python modules to be compatible with the new build system while still using the old system for building dockers -- _target end of 2019_
• update all Python services to the new system in 1-2 release cycles -- _target Q1 2020_ (trying to avoid colliding with the python3 upgrade)

cc @dlluncor @shaunak @Heymian and other curious pythonistas
https://docs.google.com/document/d/19JrBYswOYaH3lqqMAYSH06A0MInYonA5Q97wpm0aFZo/edit#
This is great work, @lydia , it will make things so much easier!!
a lot of it was possible with your requirements.in (http://requirements.in) / pip-compile ideas :slightly_smiling_face:
i use it a lot to create multiple layers in our docker so we don't have to rebuild everything whenever our python code changes!
the trickiest part was trying to implement this while staying performant in docker builds, local dev, unit tests, etc
